column1: Cow-Calf production costs and returns per cow
Capital recovery of machinery and equipment ?
Value of production less total costs listed
Value of production less operating costs
Beef cows on farm or ranch (head per farm/ranch)
Cows and heifers calving ?  (head per farm/ranch)
Stockers and Yearlings sold ?  (head per farm/ranch)
Source: USDA, Economic Research Service using data from USDA's Agricultural Resource Management Survey and other sources.
Survey base years are those in which a survey of producers was conducted. These years provide a baseline from which estimates in subsequent years are set.
The regions are ERS Farm Resource Regions.
Includes operations with at least 20 beef cows. Excludes operations that retained calves until slaughter.
?  Other cattle includes the value of cull cattle and breeding stock sales.

?  Value of production by type of cattle was reported from 1996-2007. This was matched with the categories reported since 2008 by classifying Steer and Heifer calves as Calves, and Yearling steers and Yearling heifers as Stockers and yearlings.

?  Feed costs by type of feed were reported from 1996-2007. These were matched with the categories reported since 2008 by classifying Harvested forages as Homegrown harvested feed, Concentrates and other feed and Supplemental feed as Purchased feed, and Cropland pasture, Private pasture, and Public land as Grazed feed.
?  Machinery and equipment, beef cattle housing and holding facilities, feed storage structures, and beef cattle breeding herd.
?  Cows and heifers calving, calves sold, and stockers and yearlings sold were not reported prior to 2008.
